summary:
MSc in Architectural Engineering & Building Sciences, BSc in Architecture, Urbanism and Building Sciences
I studied architecture because of being mesmerized about the way that the built environment shapes and enhances our society and lives. While studying architecture I developed my own vision of integrating spatial, functional and innovative technical design in one product. However, after working for some years in different architecture offices, I developed a passion for interiors and hospitality design and decided to start my own company, WeDesign Lab, in order to able to fully express my personal vision on the built environment.

WeDesign Lab is operating in the fields of architecture, interior design, project and construction management. Our current projects are located all over Europe with main focus in Italy, Greece and Romania. We specialise in hospitality design, including interior & exterior design, concept creation, upscale renovations, energy performance consulting as well as building typology researches.
Our high-end projects include both new building construction and renovations of interiors of all sizes, small to large. We are committed to delivering inspired designs that fulfil client expectations through collaboration and exceptional service.

education.field_of_study: Bachelor of Architecture, Urbanism and Building Sciences

projects.title: Design of Ajul Luxury Hotel & Spa Resort
projects.description: A key design focus was the delicate balance between creating a luxurious hotel environment and delivering a calm, relaxing experience. To achieve this balance, soft, earthy colour tones were utilised throughout the spaces, while furniture and decorative elements with natural materials and signature morphology were incorporated, as well as special textures with patterned fabrics, evoking a bohemian atmosphere. At the same time, new private swimming pools were designed, highlight lighting elements with a special functional and aesthetic character were utilized, while the plantings were redesigned, with native Mediterranean plants and the flooring of the surrounding area with cast materials and gravel, to ensure a new , integrated experience of luxurious escape and relaxation.

projects.title: Renovation of Wyndham Grand Crete Mirabello Bay
projects.description:
Wyndham Grand Crete Mirabello Bay is located in the hillsides of Lasithi, Crete, a place of rare, unspoiled beauty. It is a large beach front complex consisting of 311 guest rooms & bungalows and bars, as well as conference facilities with a 550 people capacity. The hotel complex combines the facilities of an all-year resort destination and conference tourism. The main design challenge was to integrate elements of contemporary luxury and traditional Cretan motifs in the interiors, while maintaining the effortless atmosphere of a seaside resort.

The aim of the architectural project was the functional, morphological and general building renovation of the hotel based on its functional needs.  200 rooms were renovated and 100 new private pools were built.

The design interprets the landscape into forms, into unique spaces, while following the quiet sounds of sea and wind that are manifested in the choice of materials, lighting and colouring.
The concept of the outdoor spaces is to create the absolute resort destination by maximising the connection of each space with the views. A series of private pools surround the buildings and resemble the feeling of the sea. The design is inspired by the underlying forms of the ground and effectively makes use of the different height levels. The outdoor spaces with the pools create the feeling of awe as you feel like swimming in the skies and unify this experience with the unique design form. The spaces around the pool follow minimalistic lines enabling the guests to completely relax.

The overall concept of the design is to create a bohemian chic resort hotel. The bohemian design culture reflects the spirit of the traditions and characteristics of the location while the “chic” refers to the luxurious spaces, the choices of the materials and the creation of experiences.

projects.title: Renovation of Grand Hotel Savoia in Cortina d'Ampezzo
projects.description:
“Designing a luxury hotel in the heart of the Dolomites!”
The renovation of the the interior of the historic hotel Grand Hotel Savoia in Cortina d”Ampezzo

The approach of the team
In our opinion the change in the face of the hotel towards the city concerns both the surrounding area such as garden and terrace as well as the interior. The projection of a new aesthetic, perceived through the openings, will be clearly reflected in the profile of its new visitors.

We wanted to create a hotel that is by itself a tourist attraction. The building itself and its interior become a destination, either because of its facilities or, and mainly we refer to it, due to the peculiarity of its design.

For this to happen we needed a strong central idea, something that has to do with both the operation and the design and was done in collaboration with the hotelier and the brand that has been chosen. The design, even when it concerns only the interior, can not be done with "decorative" criteria but be based on the genius loci of the area and the building.

The goal in Grand Hotel Savoia is to result in spaces that create a post-image, after image, capable of creating the desire of the visitor to return, again and again seeking the feeling of familiarity that every successful hotel unit must provide.

The design
The design aimed to create a strong and new identity. Serene mountain beauty, idyllic snow-covered slopes and the distinctive culture of the area have deeply influenced the formation of the interior design concept. A comfortable, stylish and cozy retreat after a long day of skiing or walking is created by blending rustic style with an elegant and luxurious touch. Fluffy and playful items complete the interior look creating a positively modern chalet dream and activate the feeling of surprise and awe.

projects.title: Zero Energy Transformation of the Dutch "Strokenbouw" Residential Buildings
projects.description: This project is part of my graduation project in Architectural Engineering. My objective is to create a manual on transforming existing residential buildings into zero energy buildings. The demand for energy efficiency in the building sector is a fact. The need for zero-energy buildings in the future would not only be more relevant than today, it will be obligatory for all buildings in use. Professionals in the building sector, including architects, managers, building engineers and academia, have to respond in the need to change the ways of construction, designing, choosing certain materials in order to contribute in a more sustainable society. It is crucial that the designers of today and all professionals of the building sector thrive to create sustainable architecture. Change the way we see architecture and the goals that the building environment has to fulfill. The more examples of realized energy efficient or even zero-energy buildings the faster the knowledge will grow.

projects.title: "The Healing Power of Space"
projects.description:
Abstract of my Architectural History Thesis:

The power of architecture to contribute to health and the healing process is traced back in the 18th century. However, healing architecture is a notion which developed the last couple of decades. Empirical research evidence showed that aspects that architects can control have an influence in the quality of patient experience and health outcomes. This thesis aims to elaborate on these aspects and create an overview of significant knowledge. This knowledge is projected in health care facilities influenced by great architectural movements. The interaction between the buildings, architectural movement and healing aspects is explored.

Key words: Healthcare architecture, healing space, healing environment, theory, architectural movements

For additional information on this project or consult requests regarding the creation of healing environments, please do not hesitate to contact me.

profile_positions.title: Founder | Head of Design at WeDesign Lab

profile_positions.description: I was asked to design projects from the initial client briefing through to the final stages of construction. My responsibilities included managing client relationships, developing and presenting design proposals, preparing drawings, specifications, construction documents, and managing project teams.
profile_positions.title: Architect

profile_positions.description: I held the position of design assistant in two design projects (restaurant, bar and spa design of a 5 star hotel in Crete and a winery/ wine exhibition space in Naousa). The tasks included computer aided design of furniture, arrangement of those and supervision during the completion of the two projects.
profile_positions.title: Architectural Assistant

profile_positions.description: As an Architectural Designer, I planned and designed the layouts for buildings and landscapes. I have worked under the direct supervision of licensed Architects.
profile_positions.title: Architectural Designer

profile_positions.description:
LIAG is a full circle architecture firm with our own building services department. And we have a rock-solid vision: architecture must create conditions for the happiness of its users. That is our responsibility to society. That is what we strive for with heart and soul with our 30 employees every day.

LIAG architecten en bouwadviseurs (1919 - Den Haag) is een integraal werkend architectenbureau. LIAG creëert een omgeving waarin de gebruikers zich optimaal kunnen ontwikkelen en hun welbevinden maximaal ondersteund wordt. Het geluk van de gebruikers vormt het uitgangspunt voor LIAG. Onze gebouwen ondersteunen het functioneren van alle gebruikers maximaal. Bij onze ontwerp- en realisatieprocessen wordt rekening gehouden met menselijke maat en schaal, sociale veiligheid en openbare ruimte.

ARCHITECTUUR VAN GELUK • Architectuur kan veel meer kan bijdragen dan functie en vierkante meters. Boven alles staat voor ons het welzijn van de gebruikers en opdrachtgevers centraal. Om de gezamenlijke doelen om te zetten hanteren we een werkmethodiek die gekenmerkt is door open communicatie, gelijkwaardigheid en creativiteit. Hierdoor creëren we voor onze opdrachtgevers uiteindelijk gebouwen met een culturele, maatschappelijke, ecologische en economische meerwaarde. Wij omschrijven deze aanpak als architectuur van het geluk.
profile_positions.title: Architectural Drafter

profile_positions.description: De Groene Grachten is a leader in the Netherlands with its successful approach to making old buildings more sustainable. We help you make your home, office, fort, hotel, museum or church energy efficient. We do this with: tailor-made advice, construction supervision, innovation projects, communication & events.
profile_positions.title: Sustainable Renovation Intern

profile_positions.description:
Royal HaskoningDHV is an independent international engineering and project management consultancy. Our 6,500 professionals are guided by a common principle – to enhance society together. For the past 135 years, we have been working with clients in more than 150 countries on projects that have improved living circumstances for many people.

During my internship at Royal Haskoning DHV, as part of the Industry,Food and Beverages Department, I conducted research which focused on the topic of safety in industrial building design in emerging countries.
profile_positions.title: Research Intern

profile_positions.description:
Schema 4 Architects is an architectural firm based in Thessaloniki (Greece). Schema 4 Architects have extensive experience in private as well as public use projects, landscape design, building restorations, exhibition design and interior design. In designing projects of different scale, complexity and requirements they are joined by a group of permanent associates and consultants of various specialties. 

The goal of my internship at Schema 4 Architects was to practice computer aided design. As part of interior design projects, the internship tasks included the design of furniture with programs such as Autocad and Google Sketchup.
profile_positions.title: Architectural Intern
